fg 0.1
Form Generation Made Easy

Introduction    Overview    Download    Getting Started    License

Introduction

fg is a system for procedurally generating animated geometric forms in real-time. It is currently under heavy development and as such should not be used at all, by anyone, under any circumstances.

Overview

The following table lists the frameworks currently included as part of fg, along with a brief description of each.

Framework Description
fg

A triangular mesh.

fg::loadLuaBindings loads the lua bindings for the fg library into the current lua state.

All bindings should go in bindings.cpp.

Useful mathematical and geometric functions. NB: Implementation is in functions.inc.

Implementation notes:

  • It wraps a vcglib mesh with as much info as we can jam in...

This header contains the VCG implementation details of a Mesh. It only needs to be #included in files which do low vcg-level manipulations of a mesh.

Some standard mesh operators.

Operators which act directly on the vcg implementation of a mesh. NB: Vertex* is a vcg::Mesh::Vertex, not a fg::Vertex!

TODO: Figure out what the interface to an operator is...

Download

Check the code out of the Bitbucket Mercurial repository:

 https://bitbucket.org/bpio/fg

See Ben for login details.

Getting Started

Install the requirements:

  1. Cmake 2.8 http://www.cmake.org/
    fg uses CMake to build. As such, it should be possible to output project files for Xcode, Visual Studio, etc. Some build scripts are provided for some of these, to generate other projects you will need to write your own scripts (patches welcome!).
  2. xcode for Mac
  3. Eclipse/MinGW for Windows

Building fg:

  • Mac
    1. ./xcode-build.sh
    2. open build/xcode/FG.xcodeproj
    3. Select "install" target and run
    4. Open a terminal, cd to fg/bin/fgv and run "./fgv tests/basic5" for example
  • Windows
    1. Switch to Mac
    2. Follow instruction steps above :-)
